page.title: 16TRANSPORT.
page.content: A CHILD'S VIEW OF THE RAILWAY. { From my classroom window}I can see the mainline station.A network of steel and glass combined together into four arches-the lines curling and twirling-criss-crossing like a huge unravelled spider's web.I watch and listen,trains rattle and squeak by me all day. Men wearing orange fluorescent waistcoats shouting as they work on the lines-getting filthy.A hooted warning and they move to one side.Passengers in the trains-looking sad-staring at me.Screeches of brakes,whistling sounds-oily fumes hang in the air. Clank! the lines change-45003 "The County of Nottingham"-Inter-City 125 in blue,yellow and white livery,pulls out of the station.
